intro: Adinandra yaeyamensis, commonly known as the Yaeyama adinandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yaeyama Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, where it thrives in the understory of primary vegetation. Its leaves are elliptical and dark green, with a leathery texture, while its flowers are white with prominent yellow stamens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
